channel.title: Digg Top Stories
channel.description: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

item.title: What It Was Like To Photograph One Of History's Most Evil Men
item.description: A Jewish photographer describes photographing Nazi propaganda minister Joseph Goebbels.

item.title: The Cash-Strapped King Of The Nerds Plots A Comeback
item.description: “I was an arrogant little f--- when I was in my 20s,” says Harry Knowles today, grinning. “Like nobody’s bigger than me.”

item.title: The Military's Sexual Assault Epidemic
item.description: The Pentagon is struggling to quell an epidemic of sexual abuse in the armed services' hierarchical culture.

item.title: Making Ramen With A Keurig Machine Makes Kitchens Obsolete
item.description: Pop the top, tuck it under the spout, and hit the button for a ready-made cup of Ramen from you Keurig. Because doing that mess on the stove is so 2001.

item.title: Your Bank Isn't Much Safer Than The Ones That Failed In Cyprus
item.description: What's happening in Cyprus isn't a fluke or isolated event.

item.title: Photographer Documents Late Wife's Battle With Breast Cancer
item.description: If you only read one wrenching, touching, tearjerker of a story today, please make it this one.

item.title: Should You Watch The Kevin Ware Injury?
item.description: Louisville guard Kevin Ware suffered a horrific knee injury during Sunday's Elite Eight game against Duke that was so bad it spawned an ethical debate online over whether sites should be able to GIF or host video of the injury.

item.title: A Brief History Of the Condom
item.description: The history of the condom may go back further than four centuries.

item.title: All The Profanity In 'Game Of Thrones' In One Video
item.description: Fair warning: this is NSFW for language, obviously, but also for brief nudity.

item.title: The Decline And Evolution Of Sex Scenes
item.description: A quick roundup of articles on why sex scenes are disappearing from movies.

item.title: Google Declares End Of YouTube In April Fool's Prank
item.description: In an elaborate ruse, the world's most popular video site announces it's been nothing but a contest site this whole time and says it's going dark for the next decade.

item.title: Extinct Animals Should Stay Dead
item.description: Scientist Stewart Brand, who has clearly never seen 'Jurassic Park,' wants to bring 24 extinct animals back to life through reconstructing their genome and cloning them. Reasons why that plan sucks.

item.title: This May Be The Most Gruesome Injury In The History Of Televised Sports
item.description: Louisville's Kevin Ware suffered what appears to be a compound fracture of both the tibia and fibula in the first half of the Cardinals' Midwest regional final bout against Duke. The injury led to a ten-minute delay in the action and is one of the most difficult things to watch, ever.

item.title: Who Puts All Your Favorite TV Shows Online For Free?
item.description: They’re some of the most popular torrents around, but how do they get on the Internet and who puts them there?

item.title: Drone City USA
item.description: Seemingly everybody’s talking about drones. And arguably no city is paying closer attention to the national debate over these controversial unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV’s) than San Diego, the undisputed Drone Capital of America.

item.title: What Does A Tablet Do To Kids' Minds?
item.description: No one has a true scientific understanding of what the future might hold for a generation raised on portable screens.

item.title: Meteor Strike: The Complete Story Of Russia's Surprise Fireball
item.description: Here's PBS's great NOVA episode on the Russian meteor strike. (Only playable in U.S.)

item.title: Treasure Hunt Mode In Google Maps
item.description: Spotted on Hacker News. Not sure how old or new this is, but still pretty great.

item.title: What If The Sun Disappeared?
item.description: What would happen if the sun suddenly ceased to exist?

item.title: The iPhone Crime Wave
item.description: What Gotham’s gobbled Apples reveal about the nation’s falling crime rates.

item.title: Millionaire Leaving Clues To $2 Million Of Buried Treasure
item.description: For the past three years, amateur treasure hunters from around the nation have been scaling mountains and scouring forests in search of an elusive bounty of gold nuggets, jewels and rare antiquities believed to have been buried by an eccentric New Mexico millionaire.
